Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Pastor Patrick Henry Young, First Baptist Church of East Elmhurst, 100-10 Astoria Blvd, East Elmhurst, N.Y. 11369.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Ferreras-Copeland.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Pastor Patrick Henry Young, First Baptist Church of East Elmhurst, 100-10 Astoria Blvd, East Elmhurst, N.Y. 11369.

Council Member Ferreras-Copeland moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to grant Haiti a new designation for Temporary Protected Status to provide temporary immigration relief to eligible Haitian nationals in the United States, as well as to stop the detention and repatriation of Haitian nationals ineligible for immigration relief, in the wake of Hurricane Matthew.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Grant Haiti a new designation for Temporary Protected Status.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution affirming that despite president-elect Donald Trump’s senseless threats, New York City will remain a Sanctuary City for immigrant residents.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Affirming that despite president-elect Donald Trump’s senseless threats, NYC will remain a Sanctuary City for immigrant residents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the enforcement of requirements on reporting of information on the workforce of certain construction projects
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Reporting of information on the workforce of contractors performing construction work for the city.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring NYC emergency responders to use appropriate bulletproof vests.

Items.MatterName: Develop a parents’ bill of rights to be distributed at initial home visits in child protective investigations and made available online.

Items.MatterName: Providing fast food employees the ability to make voluntary contributions to not-for-profit organizations of their choice through payroll deductions, and the expiration and repeal of such amendment.

Items.Title: Resolution affirming that despite president-elect Donald Trump’s senseless threats, New York City will remain a Sanctuary City for immigrant residents.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members formally noted their objection to this item:  
Council Members Borelli, Deutsch, and Matteo.

The following Council Member formally noted his abstention on this item:  
Council Member Vallone.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Affirming that despite president-elect Donald Trump’s senseless threats, NYC will remain a Sanctuary City for immigrant residents.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Thursday, December 15, 2016.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int No. 1261-A, 38-4-0 (Negative: CMs Borelli, Deutsch, Matteo, and Ulrich);
Int No. 1262-A, 40-2-0 (Negative: CMs Borelli and Matteo).

See files for individual votes.
